page.title: 06Two village studies
page.content:
Boddington is a small village with 3 farmsand about 12 other houses. There is a small church which is the oldest building in the area,it is probably over 600 years old.The village is dominated Boddington Manor(see pg 10) It is a pretty village which is very isolated,it has no bus service and two of the cottages have nobody in them.
Elmstone Hardwick. This is the largest village in the area It has a church made of local sandstone and limestone.The village had a school,built in 1863,but closed in 1975.It is now a church for the Slavonic Mission. Every year worshipers come here from all over the world.Many were originally refugees from the Second World War,who settled here in the 1940's but who have now moved away.
